onset.Description: Onset of the event of the computer presentation of the hand image

cue-start.Description: Subject presses both buttons causing cue bar to start count-down display
cue-start.HED: (Delay/#s, (Description/Subject presses both buttons causing cue bar to start count-down display, (Sensory-event, Visual, Cue, (Rectangle,  (Center-of, Screen), (Size, Decreasing))), (Experimental-participant, (Press, (Left-side, Button)), (Press, (Right-side, Button)))))

cue-end.Description: Count-down display bar shrinks to zero size.
cue-end.HED: (Delay/# s, (Description/Count-down display bar shrinks to zero size., (Sensory-event, Visual, Cue)))

trial_type.Description: Which hand was lifted by the subject in this trial.

response_time.Description: Reaction time to lift the left or right hand after the countdown reached zero. this is the difference between event onset and cue-end in milliseconds.

stim_file.Description: Stimulus file showing hand presented on screen.
stim_file.HED: Description/Stimulus file showing hand is presented on screen, Sensory-event, Visual,((Image, ID/#),(Center-of, Screen)), Experimental-stimulus

value.Description: The code (EEG Marker value) associated with an event

Levels.1: Release of left button (i.e., raising left hand)
Levels.2: Release of right button (i.e., raising right hand)

sample.Description: The sample within the EEG data at which an event occurred

stage.Description: The current stage of the experiment.

Levels.2: Stage 2. BCI was trained on data from stage 1.
Levels.3: Stage 3. BCI was trained on data from stages 1 and 2.

HED.1: Description/Stage 1 BCI acts randomly, (Definition/Random-selection, (Experimental-condition, (Random, Predict))), Def/Random-selection
HED.2: Description/Stage 2 BCI was trained on data from stage 1, (Definition/Trained-on-random, (Experimental-condition)), Def/Trained-on-random
HED.3: Description/Stage 3 BCI was trained on data from stages 1 and 2, (Definition/Trained-on-all, (Experimental-condition)), Def/Trained-on-all

latency.Description: Estimated beginning of the data chunk used for the BCI prediction with respect to the true event as measured by parallel port trigger in this trial.

trial.Description: The current trial within this stage.

bci_prediction.Description: Which hand did the BCI predict was raised in this trial.

Levels.left: BCI predicts participant raised left hand
Levels.right: BCI predicts participant raised right hand

HED.left: Description/BCI predicts participant raised left hand, (Computational-evidence, (Left-side, Hand))
HED.right: Description/BCI predicts participant raised right hand, (Computational-evidence, (Right-side, Hand))

bci_prediction_valid.Description: Did a prediction arrive on time (if not, a random prediction was made) in this trial.

Levels.2: Computational prediction was late so random prediction was used.

HED.1: Description/Computational prediction arrived on time, (Computational-agent, Predict)
HED.2: Description/Computational prediction was late so random prediction was used., Time-out, (Random, Predict)

n_repeated.Description: Number of trials that had to be repeated until the present trial because of invalid participant behavior (within this stage).
